page.title: 02The Dulais Valley.
page.content: The Dulais Valley runs in a south-westerly direction where it joins the valley of the River Neath, the two rivers, the Dulais and the Neath (Nedd) meeting at a place called Aberdulais (the mouth of the River Dulais). At Crynant, the Dulais Valley is noticeably wide when considering the rather small river stream; the farther north-east one goes, the broad, U-shaped valley changes to a shallow depression before disappearing completely into the hillside of Mynydd-y-Drum at the southern edge of the Brecon Beacons. Both sides of the valley have recently been afforested by the Forestry Commission.
